stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes the result of using 128-bit addresses instead of 32-bit addresses?

features.html: Internet protocol version 4 (IPv4) represents each IP address as a 32-bit binary number. Internet protocol version 6 (IPv6) represents each IP address as a 128-bit binary number.

choicesHtml: 4 times as many addresses are available.
96 times as many addresses are available.
times as many addresses are available.
times as many addresses are available.
